description: Modifies the settings for a cluster. You can use this operation to change one or more cluster configuration parameters by specifying the parameters and the new values.

parameters.name: CacheClusterId
parameters.description: The cluster identifier. This value is stored as a lowercase string.

parameters.name: NumCacheNodes
parameters.description: The number of cache nodes that the cluster should have. If the value for NumCacheNodes is greater than the sum of the number of current cache nodes and the number of cache nodes pending creation (which may be zero), more nodes are added. If the value is less than the number of existing cache nodes, nodes are removed. If the value is equal to the number of current cache nodes, any pending add or remove requests are canceled. If you are removing cache nodes, you must use the CacheNodeIdsToRemove parameter to provide the IDs of the specific cache nodes to remove. For clusters running Valkey or Redis OSS, this value must be 1. For clusters running Memcached, this value must be between 1 and 40.

parameters.name: CacheNodeIdsToRemove
parameters.description: A list of cache node IDs to be removed. A node ID is a numeric identifier (0001, 0002, etc.). This parameter is only valid when NumCacheNodes is less than the existing number of cache nodes. The number of cache node IDs supplied in this parameter must match the difference between the existing number of cache nodes in the cluster or pending cache nodes, whichever is greater, and the value of NumCacheNodes in the request. For example: If you have 3 active cache nodes, 7 pending cache nodes, and the number of cache nodes in this ModifyCacheCluster call is 5, you must list 2 (7 - 5) cache node IDs to remove. (string) ---

parameters.name: AZMode
parameters.description: Specifies whether the new nodes in this Memcached cluster are all created in a single Availability Zone or created across multiple Availability Zones. Valid values: single-az | cross-az. This option is only supported for Memcached clusters.

parameters.name: NewAvailabilityZones
parameters.description: The list of Availability Zones where the new Memcached cache nodes are created. This parameter is only valid when NumCacheNodes in the request is greater than the sum of the number of active cache nodes and the number of cache nodes pending creation (which may be zero). The number of Availability Zones supplied in this list must match the cache nodes being added in this request. Scenarios: Scenario 1: You have 3 active nodes and wish to add 2 nodes. Specify NumCacheNodes=5 (3 + 2) and optionally specify two Availability Zones for the two new nodes. Scenario 2: You have 3 active nodes and 2 nodes pending creation (from the scenario 1 call) and want to add 1 more node. Specify NumCacheNodes=6 ((3 + 2) + 1) and optionally specify an Availability Zone for the new node. Scenario 3: You want to cancel all pending operations. Specify NumCacheNodes=3 to cancel all pending operations. The Availability Zone placement of nodes pending creation cannot be modified. If you wish to cancel any nodes pending creation, add 0 nodes by setting NumCacheNodes to the number of current nodes. If cross-az is specified, existing Memcached nodes remain in their current Availability Zone. Only newly created nodes can be located in different Availability Zones. For guidance on how to move existing Memcached nodes to different Availability Zones, see the Availability Zone Considerations section of Cache Node Considerations for Memcached. Scenario-1 Pending Action: Delete New Request: Delete Result: The new delete, pending or immediate, replaces the pending delete. Scenario-2 Pending Action: Delete New Request: Create Result: The new create, pending or immediate, replaces the pending delete. Scenario-3 Pending Action: Create New Request: Delete Result: The new delete, pending or immediate, replaces the pending create. Scenario-4 Pending Action: Create New Request: Create Result: The new create is added to the pending create. (string) ---

parameters.name: CacheSecurityGroupNames
parameters.description: A list of cache security group names to authorize on this cluster. This change is asynchronously applied as soon as possible. You can use this parameter only with clusters that are created outside of an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC). Constraints: Must contain no more than 255 alphanumeric characters. Must not be 'Default'. (string) ---

parameters.name: SecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: Specifies the VPC Security Groups associated with the cluster. This parameter can be used only with clusters that are created in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC). (string) ---

parameters.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
parameters.description: Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance window is a 60 minute period. Valid values for ddd are: sun mon tue wed thu fri sat Example: sun:23:00-mon:01:30

parameters.name: NotificationTopicArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to which notifications are sent.

parameters.name: NotificationTopicStatus
parameters.description: The status of the Amazon SNS notification topic. Notifications are sent only if the status is active. Valid values: active | inactive.

parameters.name: ApplyImmediately
parameters.description: If true, this parameter causes the modifications in this request and any pending modifications to be applied, asynchronously and as soon as possible, regardless of the PreferredMaintenanceWindow setting for the cluster. If false, changes to the cluster are applied on the next maintenance reboot, or the next failure reboot, whichever occurs first. Valid values: true | false Default: false.

parameters.name: EngineVersion
parameters.description: The upgraded version of the cache engine to be run on the cache nodes. Important: You can upgrade to a newer engine version (see Selecting a Cache Engine and Version), but you cannot downgrade to an earlier engine version. If you want to use an earlier engine version, you must delete the existing cluster and create it anew with the earlier engine version.

parameters.name: SnapshotRetentionLimit
parameters.description: The number of days for which ElastiCache retains automatic cluster snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set SnapshotRetentionLimit to 5, a snapshot that was taken today is retained for 5 days before being deleted.

parameters.name: AuthToken
parameters.description: Reserved parameter. The password used to access a password protected server. This parameter must be specified with the auth-token-update parameter. Password constraints: Must be only printable ASCII characters Must be at least 16 characters and no more than 128 characters in length Cannot contain any of the following characters: --/', --'', or --@', --%' For more information, see AUTH password at AUTH.

parameters.name: AuthTokenUpdateStrategy
parameters.description: Specifies the strategy to use to update the AUTH token. This parameter must be specified with the auth-token parameter. Possible values: ROTATE - default, if no update strategy is provided SET - allowed only after ROTATE DELETE - allowed only when transitioning to RBAC For more information, see Authenticating Users with AUTH.

parameters.name: LogDeliveryConfigurations
parameters.description: Specifies the destination, format and type of the logs. (dict) --- Specifies the destination, format and type of the logs. LogType (string) --- Refers to slow-log or engine-log.. DestinationType (string) --- Specify either cloudwatch-logs or kinesis-firehose as the destination type. DestinationDetails (dict) --- Configuration details of either a CloudWatch Logs destination or Kinesis Data Firehose destination. CloudWatchLogsDetails (dict) --- The configuration details of the CloudWatch Logs destination. LogGroup (string) --- The name of the CloudWatch Logs log group. KinesisFirehoseDetails (dict) --- The configuration details of the Kinesis Data Firehose destination. DeliveryStream (string) --- The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream. LogFormat (string) --- Specifies either JSON or TEXT Enabled (boolean) --- Specify if log delivery is enabled. Default true.

nested_params.name: DestinationType
nested_params.description: Specify either cloudwatch-logs or kinesis-firehose as the destination type.

nested_params.name: DestinationDetails
nested_params.description: Configuration details of either a CloudWatch Logs destination or Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_params.name: CloudWatchLogsDetails
nested_params.description: The configuration details of the CloudWatch Logs destination.

nested_params.name: LogGroup
nested_params.description: The name of the CloudWatch Logs log group.

nested_params.name: KinesisFirehoseDetails
nested_params.description: The configuration details of the Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_params.name: DeliveryStream
nested_params.description: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Specify if log delivery is enabled. Default true.

parameters.name: ScaleConfig
parameters.description: Configures horizontal or vertical scaling for Memcached clusters, specifying the scaling percentage and interval. ScalePercentage (integer) --- The percentage by which to scale the Memcached cluster, either horizontally by adding nodes or vertically by increasing resources. ScaleIntervalMinutes (integer) --- The time interval in seconds between scaling operations when performing gradual scaling for a Memcached cluster.

nested_params.name: ScalePercentage
nested_params.description: The percentage by which to scale the Memcached cluster, either horizontally by adding nodes or vertically by increasing resources.

nested_params.name: ScaleIntervalMinutes
nested_params.description: The time interval in seconds between scaling operations when performing gradual scaling for a Memcached cluster.

nested_items.name: CacheCluster
nested_items.description: Contains all of the attributes of a specific cluster.

nested_items.name: CacheClusterId
nested_items.description: The user-supplied identifier of the cluster. This identifier is a unique key that identifies a cluster.

nested_items.name: ConfigurationEndpoint
nested_items.description: Represents a Memcached cluster endpoint which can be used by an application to connect to any node in the cluster. The configuration endpoint will always have .cfg in it.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The DNS hostname of the cache node.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number that the cache engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: ClientDownloadLandingPage
nested_items.description: The URL of the web page where you can download the latest ElastiCache client library.

nested_items.name: CacheNodeType
nested_items.description: The name of the compute and memory capacity node type for the cluster.

nested_items.name: M7g node types
nested_items.type: not recommended. Existing clusters are still supported but creation of new clusters is not supported for these types.
nested_items.description: General purpose:

nested_items.name: C1 node types:
nested_items.type: not recommended. Existing clusters are still supported but creation of new clusters is not supported for these types.
nested_items.description: Compute optimized:

nested_items.name: C1 node types:
nested_items.type: not recommended. Existing clusters are still supported but creation of new clusters is not supported for these types.

nested_items.name: R7g node types
nested_items.type: not recommended. Existing clusters are still supported but creation of new clusters is not supported for these types.
nested_items.description: Memory optimized:

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: The name of the cache engine ( memcached or redis) to be used for this cluster.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the cache engine that is used in this cluster.

nested_items.name: CacheClusterStatus
nested_items.description: The current state of this cluster, one of the following values: available, creating, deleted, deleting, incompatible-network, modifying, rebooting cluster nodes, restore-failed, or snapshotting.

nested_items.name: NumCacheNodes
nested_items.description: The number of cache nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: PreferredAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The name of the Availability Zone in which the cluster is located or 'Multiple' if the cache nodes are located in different Availability Zones.

nested_items.name: PreferredOutpostArn
nested_items.description: The outpost ARN in which the cache cluster is created.

nested_items.name: CacheClusterCreateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the cluster was created.

nested_items.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance window is a 60 minute period.
sun.
mon.
tue.
wed.

fri.
sat.

nested_items.name: PendingModifiedValues
nested_items.description: A group of settings that are applied to the cluster in the future, or that are currently being applied.

nested_items.name: NumCacheNodes
nested_items.description: The new number of cache nodes for the cluster.

nested_items.name: CacheNodeIdsToRemove
nested_items.description: A list of cache node IDs that are being removed (or will be removed) from the cluster. A node ID is a 4-digit numeric identifier (0001, 0002, etc.).
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The new cache engine version that the cluster runs.

nested_items.name: CacheNodeType
nested_items.description: The cache node type that this cluster or replication group is scaled to.

nested_items.name: AuthTokenStatus
nested_items.description: The auth token status.

nested_items.name: LogDeliveryConfigurations
nested_items.description: The log delivery configurations being modified.

nested_items.name: LogType
nested_items.description: Refers to slow-log or engine-log..

nested_items.name: DestinationType
nested_items.description: Returns the destination type, either CloudWatch Logs or Kinesis Data Firehose.

nested_items.name: DestinationDetails
nested_items.description: Configuration details of either a CloudWatch Logs destination or Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogsDetails
nested_items.description: The configuration details of the CloudWatch Logs destination.

nested_items.name: LogGroup
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch Logs log group.

nested_items.name: KinesisFirehoseDetails
nested_items.description: The configuration details of the Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStream
nested_items.description: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

nested_items.name: LogFormat
nested_items.description: Returns the log format, either JSON or TEXT.

nested_items.name: TransitEncryptionEnabled
nested_items.description: A flag that enables in-transit encryption when set to true.

nested_items.name: TransitEncryptionMode
nested_items.description: A setting that allows you to migrate your clients to use in-transit encryption, with no downtime.

nested_items.name: ScaleConfig
nested_items.description: The scaling configuration changes that are pending for the Memcached cluster.

nested_items.name: ScalePercentage
nested_items.description: The percentage by which to scale the Memcached cluster, either horizontally by adding nodes or vertically by increasing resources.

nested_items.name: ScaleIntervalMinutes
nested_items.description: The time interval in seconds between scaling operations when performing gradual scaling for a Memcached cluster.

nested_items.name: NotificationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Describes a notification topic and its status. Notification topics are used for publishing ElastiCache events to subscribers using Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS).

nested_items.name: TopicArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the topic.

nested_items.name: TopicStatus
nested_items.description: The current state of the topic.

nested_items.name: CacheSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: A list of cache security group elements, composed of name and status sub-elements.

nested_items.name: CacheSecurityGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the cache security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The membership status in the cache security group. The status changes when a cache security group is modified, or when the cache security groups assigned to a cluster are modified.

nested_items.name: CacheParameterGroup
nested_items.description: Status of the cache parameter group.

nested_items.name: CacheParameterGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the cache parameter group.

nested_items.name: ParameterApplyStatus
nested_items.description: The status of parameter updates.

nested_items.name: CacheNodeIdsToReboot
nested_items.description: A list of the cache node IDs which need to be rebooted for parameter changes to be applied. A node ID is a numeric identifier (0001, 0002, etc.).
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CacheSubnetGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the cache subnet group associated with the cluster.

nested_items.name: CacheNodes
nested_items.description: A list of cache nodes that are members of the cluster.

nested_items.name: M7g node types
nested_items.type: not recommended. Existing clusters are still supported but creation of new clusters is not supported for these types.
nested_items.description: General purpose:

nested_items.name: C1 node types:
nested_items.type: not recommended. Existing clusters are still supported but creation of new clusters is not supported for these types.
nested_items.description: Compute optimized:

nested_items.name: C1 node types:
nested_items.type: not recommended. Existing clusters are still supported but creation of new clusters is not supported for these types.

nested_items.name: R7g node types
nested_items.type: not recommended. Existing clusters are still supported but creation of new clusters is not supported for these types.
nested_items.description: Memory optimized:

nested_items.name: AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
nested_items.description: If you are running Valkey or Redis OSS engine version 6.0 or later, set this parameter to yes if you want to opt-in to the next auto minor version upgrade campaign. This parameter is disabled for previous versions.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroups
nested_items.description: A list of VPC Security Groups associated with the cluster.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the cache security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the cache security group membership. The status changes whenever a cache security group is modified, or when the cache security groups assigned to a cluster are modified.

nested_items.name: ReplicationGroupId
nested_items.description: The replication group to which this cluster belongs. If this field is empty, the cluster is not associated with any replication group.

nested_items.name: SnapshotRetentionLimit
nested_items.description: The number of days for which ElastiCache retains automatic cluster snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set SnapshotRetentionLimit to 5, a snapshot that was taken today is retained for 5 days before being deleted.

nested_items.name: SnapshotWindow
nested_items.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which ElastiCache begins taking a daily snapshot of your cluster.

nested_items.name: AuthTokenEnabled
nested_items.description: A flag that enables using an AuthToken (password) when issuing Valkey or Redis OSS commands.

nested_items.name: AuthTokenLastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date the auth token was last modified.

nested_items.name: TransitEncryptionEnabled
nested_items.description: A flag that enables in-transit encryption when set to true.

nested_items.name: AtRestEncryptionEnabled
nested_items.description: A flag that enables encryption at-rest when set to true.

nested_items.name: ARN
nested_items.description: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the cache cluster.

nested_items.name: ReplicationGroupLogDeliveryEnabled
nested_items.description: A boolean value indicating whether log delivery is enabled for the replication group.

nested_items.name: LogDeliveryConfigurations
nested_items.description: Returns the destination, format and type of the logs.

nested_items.name: LogType
nested_items.description: Refers to slow-log or engine-log.

nested_items.name: DestinationType
nested_items.description: Returns the destination type, either cloudwatch-logs or kinesis-firehose.

nested_items.name: DestinationDetails
nested_items.description: Configuration details of either a CloudWatch Logs destination or Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogsDetails
nested_items.description: The configuration details of the CloudWatch Logs destination.

nested_items.name: LogGroup
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch Logs log group.

nested_items.name: KinesisFirehoseDetails
nested_items.description: The configuration details of the Kinesis Data Firehose destination.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStream
nested_items.description: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

nested_items.name: LogFormat
nested_items.description: Returns the log format, either JSON or TEXT.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Returns the log delivery configuration status. Values are one of enabling | disabling | modifying | active | error.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: Returns an error message for the log delivery configuration.

nested_items.name: NetworkType
nested_items.description: Must be either ipv4 | ipv6 | dual_stack. IPv6 is supported for workloads using Valkey 7.2 and above, Redis OSS engine version 6.2 7.1 or Memcached engine version 1.6.6 and above on all instances built on the Nitro system.

nested_items.name: IpDiscovery
nested_items.description: The network type associated with the cluster, either ipv4 | ipv6. IPv6 is supported for workloads using Valkey 7.2 and above, Redis OSS engine version 6.2 to 7.1 or Memcached engine version 1.6.6 and above on all instances built on the Nitro system.

nested_items.name: TransitEncryptionMode
nested_items.description: A setting that allows you to migrate your clients to use in-transit encryption, with no downtime.
